subject: New poll for Read_Alphabet
msgSnippet: Enter your vote today!  A new poll has been created for the Read_Alphabet group: Please vote for your preference for a new ASCII key map for the Read Alphabet,
messageBody:
Enter your vote today! A new poll has been created for the
Read_Alphabet group:

Please vote for your preference for a new ASCII key map for the Read Alphabet, from among the proposals included in the file 'qs_keybd_proposals3.csv' in the 'Files->Key mapping proposals' folder on the group website.

The purpose of this vote is to establish a standard for font developers to implement in keyboard assignments, and to facilitate the exchange of Quickscript in email and in plain text documents.

The scope of the proposals includes the 40 core letters of the alphabet, the four alternate letters, the two letters used for Scottish, Welsh and Irish place names, and the three punctuation marks unique to this alphabet. Some proposals also include the eight half-letters. In order to be considered, the proposals were required to assign all free-standing Quickscript letters to upper case or lower case Roman letters. (There are not enough letters in the Roman alphabet to maintain this requirement for all of the half-letters.) Since the Jerome keyboard map does not meet this requirement, and proposals for a minimal update of the Jerome map gained no support in group discussion, it is not included among the final candidates.

This poll will close at the end of February 2008.

Thank you for voting!

Ted Larson Freeman


o QS-SAMPA
o Peter Guinness's proposal
o QS-B
o QS-Nu
o Moira O'Brien's proposal


To vote, please visit the following web page:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/surveys?id=2650278

Note: Please do not reply to this message. Poll votes are
not collected via email. To vote, you must go to the Yahoo! Groups
web site listed above.

Thanks!
